definition:
The following is an alternative definition of an *Abelian category*
(according to Barry Mitchell’s textbook):

An *Abelian category* is an additive category with finite products.

The following theorem from ref.[@BM65] is also relevant as it relates
key properties of Abelian categories:

> “The following statements are equivalent:
>
> 1.  **${\mathcal A}$** is an Abelian category;
>
> 2.  **${\mathcal A}$** has kernels, cokernels, finite products, finite
>     coproducts, and is both normal and comormal;
>
> 3.  **${\mathcal A}$** has pushouts and pullbacks and is both normal
>     and conormal”.
>
[9]{} Barry Mitchell. *Theory of Categories*, Academic Press: New York
and London, 1965, (**Theorem 20.1** on p.33).
